text:
:wave: hello to the code maintainers. First off want to say :pray: for the python package, big fan.

Im having an issue pulling historical data at the moment. It seems like maybe `betfair` and their download historical data isnt working but want to be sure. I usually use the UI but its been returning `10kb` tar files that dont seem to open correctly. I am now trying to use the download approach found at `<https://github.com/liampauling/betfair/blob/master/examples/examplehistoricdata.py>` and added some of my own print statements:

text: maybe Im being silly :thinking_face: ... maybe the historical service is experiences issues... any help is appreciated

elements.text: maybe Im being silly
... maybe the historical service is experiences issues... any help is appreciated
Historic data API is broken
understood. thanks.

text: Betfair are in the process of rebuilding it but they’re taking ages

elements.text: Betfair are in the process of rebuilding it but they’re taking ages

text: cool :thumbsup: do they have a status page that you know of where we can keep abreast of the developments? or shall I set up a daily job and run that script until it passes? :smirk:

elements.text: cool
do they have a status page that you know of where we can keep abreast of the developments? or shall I set up a daily job and run that script until it passes?

text: Nothing that’s kept up to date. If you raise a ticket with support they should be able to send you the data via a file sharing service they use

elements.text: Nothing that’s kept up to date. If you raise a ticket with support they should be able to send you the data via a file sharing service they use

text: Legend ok thanks. Unrelated but I have noticed this issue:  <https://github.com/liampauling/betfair/issues/234> and I would like to add value. I wonder if this is going to be done piecemeal or in a single sizeable PR. Keen to chat, get a plan together and allocate some work maybe.

attachments.title: version 2 · Issue #234 · liampauling/betfair
attachments.text: todo Remove all py2 support :smile: Remove all threading from streaming (no more async_) Better logging on streaming (send/errors etc.) Fix #217 do we want to continue using ujson? Resources refactor, us...

elements.text: Legend ok thanks. Unrelated but I have noticed this issue:
and I would like to add value. I wonder if this is going to be done piecemeal or in a single sizeable PR. Keen to chat, get a plan together and allocate some work maybe.
’s your man for that

text: Yep very keen to get input from everyone and thinking a branch for the version with lots of PR’s

elements.text: Yep very keen to get input from everyone and thinking a branch for the version with lots of PR’s
